unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Wildlife Conservation Efforts Intensify in Kerala**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Wildlife Conservation Efforts Intensify in Kerala**

unnormalised: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala - October 26, 2023 – The Kerala Forest Department, in collaboration with the Wildlife Trust of India (WTI), has announced intensified conservation efforts in the Western Ghats, focusing on the endangered Nilgiri Tahr. Dr. E. Janardhanan, Chief Wildlife Warden, stated that Rs. 50 lakhs has been allocated for habitat restoration in the Eravikulam National Park.
normalised: Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala - October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – The Kerala Forest Department, in collaboration with the Wildlife Trust of India (W T I), has announced intensified conservation efforts in the Western Ghats, focusing on the endangered Nilgiri Tahr. Doctor E. Janardhanan, Chief Wildlife Warden, stated that rupee fifty lakhs has been allocated for habitat restoration in the Eravikulam National Park.

unnormalised: The project aims to remove invasive species and plant native flora, thereby improving the grazing land for the Tahr. Monitoring efforts will also be ramped up using camera traps and patrol teams covering an area of approximately 100 sq km.
normalised: The project aims to remove invasive species and plant native flora, thereby improving the grazing land for the Tahr. Monitoring efforts will also be ramped up using camera traps and patrol teams covering an area of approximately one hundred square kilometer.

unnormalised: Furthermore, awareness programs are planned for local communities residing near the forest boundaries to foster greater participation in conservation initiatives. The Dept. also highlighted the importance of preserving sacred groves ('kavu' in Malayalam) which often act as crucial wildlife corridors. Preliminary reports suggest a positive trend in Tahr population, but continued vigilance is critical.
